required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Antenatal Iron-contained Multiple Micronutrient Supplementation, Cesarean Delivery, and CDMR on Child Health
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Antenatal Iron-contained Multiple Micronutrient Supplementation, Cesarean Delivery, and CDMR on Child Health- A Post-trial Follow-up Chinese Study

brief_summary.textblock: The follow-up study was based on our previous nutritional intervention trial entitled "Impact of Prenatal Vitamin/Mineral Supplements on Perinatal Mortality (NCT00133744)". We followed up all livebirths born to women of the trial to measure their height, weight, and hemoglobin and to implement a questionaire survey (including developmental milestones, disease history, breast feeding, passive smoking, et al). We selected a sub-sample of infants to assess their IQ, emotional and behavioral problem, and language development status. The outcomes of interest include death, body mass index, overweight/ obesity, stunting/ wasting/ thinness, anemia, developmental milestones, IQ, emotional and behavioral disorder, language developmental status, and disease history. Other interesting exposure includes breast feeding, passive smoking, et al. We hypothesize that intrauterine nutritional exposure has an impact on offspring's physical, mental, and language development. We also hypothesize that cesarean delivery including CDMR has an impact on offspring's these outcomes.

detailed_description.textblock: The follow-up study was based on our previous nutritional intervention trial entitled "Impact of Prenatal Vitamin/Mineral Supplements on Perinatal Mortality (NCT00133744)". We followed up all livebirths born to women of the trial to measure their height, weight, and hemoglobin and to implement a questionaire survey (including developmental milestones, disease history, breast feeding, passive smoking, et al). We selected 1200 <30 months infants to assess their IQ with Bayley scale, emotional and behavioral problem with CBCL scale, and language development status with LDS scale. We also selected 1500 >30 months children to measure their emotional and behavioral problem with CBCL scale. The exposure groups include intrauterine nutritional exposure and cesarean delivery exposure as well as CDMR. The outcomes of interest include death, body mass index, overweight/ obesity, stunting/ wasting/ thinness, anemia, developmental milestones, IQ, emotional and behavioral disorder, language developmental status, and disease history. Other interesting exposure includes breast feeding, passive smoking, et al. We hypothesize that intrauterine nutritional exposure has an impact on offspring's physical, mental, and language development. We also hypothesize that cesarean delivery including CDMR has an impact on offspring's these outcomes.

study_pop.textblock: all livebirths born to women of our previous trial (NCT00133744) who were from Laoting, Fengrun, Xianghe, Mancheng, and Yuanshi counties of China.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all livebirths
Exclusion Criteria:
- died
- moved out
- refused to participate
- being incapable of participation

facility.name: Mancheng Maternal and Child Health Hospital
Xianghe Maternal and Child Health Hospital
Yuanshi Maternal and Child Health Hospital
Fengrun Maternal and Child Health Hospital
Laoting Maternal and Child Health Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_title: Institute of Reproductive and Child Health
